newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile Quebrada Blanca pit starts pay talks March.
newsitem.headline: Chile Quebrada Blanca pit starts pay talks March.

text.p: Chile's Quebrada Blanca copper mine will start wage talks next month to renew the pit's collective contract which expires at the end of April, said general manager James Drake.
"We expect to talks to begin mid-March," Drake told Reuters.
The company signed the current contract in November 1994 and will offer workers at least another two-year deal, he said, adding, "It'll be for not less than two years and probably for four."
Drake said the mine employs 500 workers, 70 percent of whom belong to a union.
Vancouver-based Cominco Ltd, Cominco Resources and Teck Resources International hold a 76.5 percent stake in the mine which lies on a plateau near the Bolivian border.
Quebrada Blanca produced 68,000 tonnes of copper last year and official expect output to rise to the pit's 75,000 tonne design capacity this year.
